name: Dragonite

abilities.name: Step In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dragonite is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

flavorText: An extremely rarely seen marine Pokémon. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans.

strengths: Step In provides excellent mobility and tactical options
100 HP is very high for the era
Colorless energy cost allows any energy type
weaknesses: Stage 2 requires significant setup (Dratini -> Dragonair -> Dragonite)
Slam is coin flip dependent and unreliable
4 energy for potentially 0 damage is inefficient
The Dragonair line doesn't exist in Fossil (requires Base Set or other sets)
synergies: Switch (can use Step In then switch something else in)
counters: Gust of Wind to force out before ready

competitiveHistory: This non-holo version of Dragonite is functionally identical to the holo version (#4). Dragonite's Step In power was innovative but the Stage 2 requirement and unreliable attack limited its competitive impact. The non-holo printing made it more accessible for players wanting to experiment with the card.

rulings.ruling: Step In can be used even if your Active Pokemon is affected by a status condition.
Step In is considered switching, so effects that trigger on switching apply.
You cannot use Step In if Dragonite is your Active Pokemon - it must be on your Bench.
Slam does 0 damage if both coin flips are tails.
